page.title: 05HEALTH
page.content: Wiveliscombe is looking forward to its new health centre.It is hoped that it will be opened early in 1986,with three consulting rooms,a treatment room,a nurses room and dispensary. The most common illness in local children are coughs,measles and chicken pox.In adults high blood pressure and flu.The number of patients per doctor is 1600. They cover an area going as far as Upton,Ashbrittle<Stawley and Bradford on Tone. Dr.Watson retired in 1984 and he misses his work,mostly meeting people and being able to help them.He didn't like problems he couldnt solve. His replacement,Dr.Rostrum,was born in Cornwall and used to work in Wiltshire.Dr.Hoe and Dr.Rees find it very sad that Dr.Watson is no longer with them although they get on well with Dr.Rostrum.The average age at death of people in Wiveliscombe is 70.
